Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Complaint:
My name is Michael Jackson, and I am disputing the accuracy of multiple late payments being reported by XXXX XXXX  on my account ending in XXXX. My credit reports with Experian, Equifax, and TransUnion show late payments for XX/XX/2024 through XX/XX/2024. 

These late payments are not accurate, not verified, and therefore not compliant with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Under FCRA 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), furnishers of information must provide accurate and complete reporting.

Under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), I have the right to a reasonable reinvestigation. I demand documented proof from the furnisher.

To date, no original source documentation has been provided to verify these alleged late payments. 

If XXXX XXXX can not produce proper verification, these late payments must be deleted from all credit reports as unverified. 



Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Explanation: 1. Basic. The complainant's name, "Michael Jackson," is still visible.
Label: Yes

Product: Checking or savings account
Complaint:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally request your assistance in reopening and reviewing my dispute with Bank of America regarding fraudulent transactions that occurred on my Bank of America checking account ending in XXXX. 

The main claim number at issue is XXXX for a total disputed amount of {$24000.00}. 

Summary of Events I experienced identity theft resulting in multiple fraudulent ACH payments to XXXX XXXX from my Bank of America account. 

I immediately reported the fraud to Bank of America and submitted both : FTC Identity Theft Report Police Report Bank of America processed my dispute but split it into multiple claims. 

They credited and approved XXXX portion of the claim ( related to the same fraudulent XXXX XXXX transactions ), but denied the rest, even though all transactions are part of the same identity theft incident and are linked to the same case. 

My Concern Bank of Americas approach is inconsistent and unfair : If they acknowledged and reimbursed XXXX  transaction as fraudulent, all related transactions from the same merchant and same fraud event should be treated the same way. 

Their internal disorganization and decision to split my case into multiple claims should not penalize me, the victim. 

By denying the remaining transactions, they are effectively holding me responsible for fraud that I did not authorize, despite my timely reporting and submission of all required documents. 

What I Am Requesting That the CFPB instruct Bank of America to reopen claim # XXXX and treat all related transactions under XXXX unified case. 

That Bank of America either : Provide verifiable, signed proof that I personally authorized these transactions, or Immediately credit the funds back to my account under the protections of Regulation E, which requires reimbursement for unauthorized electronic fund transfers when reported in a timely manner. 

Supporting Evidence FTC Identity Theft Report ( submitted to Bank of America ) Police Report ( submitted to Bank of America ) Bank of America correspondence showing partial reimbursement was issued for a related transaction but others were denied This situation is creating significant financial hardship for me, and I believe it represents a failure by Bank of America to correctly process a linked set of fraudulent transactions. I respectfully request CFPB intervention to ensure that I am made whole for the total disputed amount. 

Thank you for your time and assistance. 

Sincerely, Michael Jordan, CA
Explanation:
Category 1.
The complaint still includes the complainant's name, "Michael Jordan," and their state of residence, "CA."
Label: Yes

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Complaint:
Name : Erling Haaland Address Line : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Document Date : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Subject : REQUEST LETTER TO REMOVE INACCURATE INFORMATION To Whom It May Concern, Please accept this formal letter as my first request to investigate and remove derogatory accounts/items from my consumer report. Going over my report, I have found it has errors. It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I believe to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. 
As a consumer reporting agency 15 U.S.C. $ 1681a ( f ), you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 'FCRA '' ). 15 U.S.C. 1681, et seq., which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their consumer file. The FCRA states that it's the consumer reporting agency 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer files is accurate and free from errors. 
Your company is regularly engaged in the business of assembling, evaluating, and disbursing information concerning consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports, as defined in 15 U.S.C. {$1600.00} ( d ), to third parties.

According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to : 1 ) follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This section imposes a high and often disregarded standard on consumer reporting agencies. See, e.g., XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ( breaking down the requirements of 1681e ( b ), and explaining that " assure ' means 'to make sure or certain : put beyond all doubt, '' ' [ maximum ' means the 'greatest in quantity or highest degree attainable [, ] ' and 'possible ' means something falling within the bounds of what may be done, occur or be conceived. '' ( quoting XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) ) ; 2 ) comply with the investigation requirements, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ; 3 ) should not provide consumer files to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer files pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; 4 ) provide consumer file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681g ; 5 ) et seq. 
Accordingly, I request your company to provide verifiable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it ) you have on file of accounts/items listed below. Under the FCRA, if you do not provide documented and verifiable proof, you must remove all unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report. 
For your convenience, I am sending you a list of the items you need to verify them. These listed accounts are neither my debts nor my authorized inquiries. Please correct this by the removal of these items from my consumer report. See. Exhibit A. 
Upon completion of your investigation, please send a detailed description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy of the accounts/items XXXX XXXX disputing, as well as the name and contact information of the agent conducting the said investigation in case further communication is necessary.
Explanation: it still contains personal information. It belongs to category 1 (Basic) because the name "Erling Haaland" is present.
Label: Yes

Complaint: XX/XX/2021 XXXX XXXX XXXX {$2500.00} XX/XX/2021 XXXX XXXX # XXXX {$2000.00} XX/XX/2021 XXXX # XXXX {$2900.00} On XX/XX/2021 and XX/XX/2021, the charges above were made with my credit card. I notified the bank immediately that the charges were fraudulent. However, after they investigated, the found that my physical card was used and because it had a chip in it, determined that I was liable. The problem is that I opened the account on XX/XX/2021. However, I never received the initial card. Some time before XX/XX/2021, I reported that I never received the card, and requested a new one sent to me. Importantly, I asked the representative to cancer the initial card since it was lost or stolen. However, he may not have canceled the first card before sending me the second card. On XX/XX/2021, I found the 3 fraudulent charges above and reported them to the fraud prevention team. After the Chase investigated, they said that I was liable for the charges because a chip card was used and it is nearly impossible to counterfeit those cards. It may have been that the first card that I never received was used. If so, I should not be liable for those charges since I did not make the purchases and the representative should have canceled that card when he sent me the second.

Complaint: I was given a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and was put on a plan to pay monthly with the understanding that I wouldn't own the equipment until I had paid a specific dollar amount. My insurance company, XXXX, was also billed and paid for a portion of the equipment. Within 3 weeks of that notice I took the equipment back to the medical office that gave it to me, with every accessory that came with it and in the original carrying case. I also provided them a copy of one of the recall notices that I got from XXXX XXXX and a copy of the XXXX XXXX website showing the specific model that I was given. I asked for someone to confirm that my billing would stop and was told that there was nobody available at that time so I instructed the girl at the front desk to discontinue billing me and to discontinue billing my insurance company and I left the recalled equipment in their office. The billing continued to accrue for several months coming to a balance of {$320.00}. I called their office and requested that they cease and desist billing me for a recalled piece of equipment that was potentially cancer causing, and that I had returned to them. When that didn't happen I went INTO their office and told a different receptionist at the front desk to get with whomever was handling insurance billing and stop the billing. I don't know what else to do to get help and get this removed from my credit reports. I have provided and requested documentation for any sort of verification. They continued to fraudulently bill my credit card AND DEFRAUD MY INSURANCE COMPANY.

Complaint: In XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted a goodwill adjustment letter to Citizens Bank regarding a single 30-day late payment reported for XX/XX/XXXX. I explained that this occurred during a period of significant medical hardship, as I was actively experiencing symptoms that were later confirmed to be cancer-related, culminating in a formal diagnosis in XX/XX/XXXX. Rather than address the goodwill request directly, Citizens initially treated the matter as a standard credit dispute and denied it on the basis that the reporting was accurate. I was later contacted by XXXX from the Office of the Customer ( OOC ), who acknowledged that Citizens has a separate process for medical hardship-based disputes. He stated that certain exceptions are permitted under specific laws and regulations. On or around XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX informed me that he had formally submitted a medical hardship dispute on my behalf. As of XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed that this medical dispute was denied again on the basis that the reporting was accurate, despite the extenuating circumstances. I was never asked to provide documentation or supporting evidence, though I am fully prepared to do so. I believe the denial of this exception did not fully account for the nature of my medical hardship and the bank 's own recognition that such disputes qualify for review under separate policies. I am requesting that this 30-day late payment be removed in light of my cancer-related hardship at the time. Complaint: At the start of XX/XX/XXXX I entered into a debt settlement agreement with Americor Financial. I had accumulated enormous credit card debt when my dad and brother passed away from different cancers and I was spending alot of time in hospitals and helping my mom with their care. The representative @ Americor, XXXX XXXX, was a slick talker who said he'd been with the company for 9 yrs. He explained how the XXXX account was set up, how after 15 months, with good payment history, that I could get a line of credit where Americor paid everyone off and I'd just make one payment to them. That my credit score would rebound when this happened. During that 15 months I made double payments probably 7 or 8 times, as I could. There was one month when I asked to delay the payment and double the following month, that was when my dad died. They said no problem, no negative effects, and I made a double payment the following month. As far as I was aware this was the only glitch. When the 15 month time frame came up ( last XX/XX/XXXX ) I was told I'd have to wait another 18 months because I was late on a payment. I said that is not correct, which payment was I late on? They said the 1st payment. I was extremely upset because I am very proactive and calling customer service all the time to ask questions on details. At the start of the program, I tried to email and call Mr XXXX and was told he'd left the company. Throughout the 1st 15 months, I would speak with negotiators, take their direct #, then when I tried to call back to talk to that individual was told they were no longer with the company. This happened with at least 3 negotiators. There was NO continuity with advice I was given. Many times I'd get someone on the customer service line who was new, who gave me false incorrect information ( such as when to make my 1st payment ), and I'd constantly be put on hold because I'd ask questions that the agent had to check with someone else to be able to answer. Over and over I would get conflicting information from these people and they did everything possible to keep me from talking to an actual negotiator. Over the months they made payments to some of the creditors and I was so upset when last XXXX I would not get the line of credit, knowing that my credit score would be in the gutter for another 18 months. They would not listen to me when I told them I was just following instructions given by their representatives, as far as their story of me missing the 1st payment. Unfortunately at that time I still trusted this company and didn't record names and exact times/dates of conversations. I didn't think I needed to. So last XXXX I instructed them to pay off 3 of the 5 accounts in question and that I wanted to end my association with them. ( In the next few weeks I made phone calls and negotiated a settlement myself. The remaining account is still out there, a XXXX account that they have not charged off to anyone else at this time. ) What I am writing to you about, and filing a formal complaint, is that these people are fraudulent, in what they promised me, in what they described would happen during the process, and in all the bogus information I was given by various customer service representatives who did not know what they were talking about. My credit score is negatively impacted because I quit paying according to what they told me to do. I am still fighting with all 3 bureaus to change the language to " Paid '' instead of " Charged Off ''. Americor representatives told me in no uncertain terms that when I fulfilled the terms of any settlement offer, it would be reflected that the debt was paid in full. That that was to be an integral part of the settlement. Imagine my frustration finding out now, that this absolutely just does not happen, ever. That any change in terminology is totally up to each bureau. Now 2 years have gone by and I am still suffering. I improved my utilization percentage from 80 % to the low 40 % and only gained 8 points from that. If I had known then what I know now, I NEVER would have gotten involved with these liars. I am so upset about everything. They were flakes from the start. They insisted I fax a power of attorney form with my full social security # on it and then said they lost the fax. This is extremely troubling, especially since earlier this year I got a letter from the IRS saying that a fraudulent return for XX/XX/XXXX had been filed in my name using my soc sec #. Did someone from Americor take my number? I will never know. These people are total flakes. It was the worst mistake of my life getting involved with them. I am still suffering the consequences, and it looks like I will be for a very long time. I have called the credit bureaus, Americor, all the creditors, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, I am so tired of being told " give it another 30 days '' I've been told that for years now. I spoke with a representative from National Debt Relief, ( listed as a top 10 company in Consumer Reports for debt settlement ) and he told me he had never heard of Americor Financial!!! That didn't exactly instill any confidence. These people do not deserve to be in this business. Trusting them has basically destroyed my financial life. That is my story.
Explanation:
It belongs to categories 2 and 4.
The complaint describes the complainant's character trait as "very proactive" (category 2) and mentions "different cancers" of their dad and brother (category 4).

Complaint: Complaint Letter This complaint is being lodged against Citibank. And that they closed my checking and savings accounts without notifying meand for no reason. About 4 months ago, after having recovered sufficiently from a fractured pelvis to ambulate, I went into my Citibank branch in XXXX XXXX, XXXX to ask a question. Do I need a Citibank power of attorney specifically for Citibank or will my general power of attorney suffice? The answer. I will need a POA from Citibank if I want my daughter who lives 4 blocks from me to be able to access funds. So they gave me the necessary papers and instructions as to what needed to be filled out. My daughter is XXXX years old and an XXXX ; I am XXXX and a retired XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX. I returned the papers, filled out as instructed. They were approved by my personal banker. '' A few days later I received a call from him, saying I needed to come in. I did. My signature was not notarized, which was true. That was because I had been told that it didnt need to be. I got new forms and both my daughters and my signatures were notarized. I returned them to the branch. A few days later, quite by accident, I noticed on my on-line statement that there was a letter for me. I opened it only to be horrified -- my accounts were going to be closed in 3 weeks. The letter did not tell me why, only that I should go to my branch. I didthis time more than a little annoyed. My " personal banker '' called in the manager, XXXX XXXX, who reviewed all the papers again and assured me that there must have been some error and that now they were all fine. I asked him to sign a copy of the forms he had in his hand so that I had proof that all was taken care of. He did. Less than 2 weeks later, on a Saturday evening, XXXX XXXX I went online to pay bills. ACCOUNTS CLOSED was the message that came up when I tried to log into my Citibank account. I almost had a heart attack. Ninety percent of my bills are automatically paid from this account. All my income is automatically received into this account. I had no access to money. Ive never been late in any payment for anything including my mortgage which is also held by Citibank. My credit rating was perfect. My blood pressure, already high but controllable, became dangerously high. I immediately called my daughter, the XXXX, and my son, the XXXX XXXX at one of the nations largest credit unions. The next morning, Sunday, he and I were on the phone with Citibanks customer service ( which, of course, couldnt help ) except to say that a check was mailed and that it would come in 12-14 days. ( So the bank was earning interest on the float of almost {$70000.00} to boot! ) The following day, I and my daughter, who took the day off from work, spent from 9-2 in the manager XXXX XXXX XXXX office until he rectified the bank errors. ( He had been at this branch for less than a month ... and was resolute in getting this fixed. ) We got my account reopened with apologies from XXXX XXXX who said he had done at least 10 of these reversals. And he called me later that evening that the bank couldnt stop payment on the check. I had to borrow {$5000.00} to put into my account so bills could be paid. Even if all the paperwork for the power of attorney was incorrect ( which it wasnt ), why would that trigger closing an account? Couldnt they just have said no to the power of attorney? Why couldnt the bank stop payment on their own check even though they could if I called and asked them to stop one of mine? And how could they close an account for no reason ( or any reason ) without notifying the holder? This is a cautionary tale. If this could happen to me, someone who herself knows personal finance, someone whose children have tremendous connections and knowledge of banking laws, and someone who has a child whose job allows her to take a day off from work to advocate for her mother what happens to other older people or those less fortunate or knowledgeable? What happens to people who dont have access to additional funds and might have to wait 12-14 days before they get their own money back? How would this craziness affect their health? What would they do? Was this age-related? Was this just the ineptitude of one person or a system? Is this how banks do business nowadays? This has been an upsetting experience even though the bank manager was determined to resolve the issue asap and even though I expect to be made whole ( financially ). It almost gave me a heart attack. I am hoping that the CFPB can find the answer and rectify the system that Citibank ( and perhaps other banks ) use. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX, NY XXXX
Explanation: The redacted complaint still contains personal information from Category 4: Medical conditions, as it explicitly mentions a "fractured pelvis" and "high blood pressure."
Label: Yes

I could then re-focus my time and energy towards my XXXX recovery from the accident. Unfortunately, while in this concussion-recovery period, an extended warranty for {$2500.00} was erroneously purchased and included in my Honda financing. By the time I was introduced to the dealer 's finance staff that day, I was quite exhausted ; I had already been at the dealership for several hours. I certainly appreciated the 2.9 % APR but really was not making good decisions at that point. Within a few days I recognized the error and contacted the finance staff to rectify the situation and cancel the extended warranty. I was informed that the warranty could be cancelled but would not reduce my monthly payment or be taken off the balance due in the purchase agreement. The {$2500.00} XXXX would be subtracted at the end of my payment period. This would mean that my payments would end approximately ten months earlier at four years and two months, instead of the initial plan of five years of payments. I found this to be quite an irregular policy as I would then be paying interest and tax on an item I have no longer purchased ; an item I do not own! I do not want to pay tax and interest on an item that I do not own. If I return an item at the hardware store they would logically return the price of the item and the tax. If I did not purchase an item on a credit card, the credit card company would logically not charge me interest. Why am I being charged for an item I do not own? I am hoping that you may understand my perspective and logic, and be able to offer a solution.
Explanation:
The redacted complaint still contains information belonging to **4. Medical conditions**.
The complaint explicitly states the individual received "several cuts, bruises and shock" and "a concussion," along with ongoing recovery from these injuries.
Label: Yes

Complaint: I have business and personal accounts and credit cards with Chase. The fraud occurred on my business account which has been open since XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, I was sent an email from Chase notifying me that they processed my request to change my email address. I did not request to change my email address. I tried to log into my Chase app with my Face ID and could not get into my account. I went home to try to log in on my computer, and I still could not get into my Chase account. My password was not working. Upon trying to reset the password, I was given an option to have a code texted to my cell number. There was an additional number on my profile ending in XXXX. ( See attached ) This number does not belong to me, and I dont know who it belongs to. This number was added to my account by the person who illegally accessed my account. When I got into my account online, there was also a XXXX email address added to my account that does not belong to me ( see attached ). There were no fraudulent transactions made on my account at this time. I removed the email and phone number that was added to my account. I contacted Chase, and they shut down online access and instructed me to go to the branch the next day with two forms of ID to get access to the account online. On XX/XX/XXXX, I went into a Chase branch and spoke with a banker. I showed my two forms of ID, and we set up a new password for my account. On the evening of XX/XX/XXXX, I tried to log into my Chase app with my Face ID on my cell phone and was not able to get into my account. I tried again on my computer and was still not able to get into my account. I reset the password and logged into my account. There were 7 Online ACH Payments made on my account, totaling {$10000.00} ( see attached ). Individually, the charges were {$500.00}, {$500.00}, {$1000.00}, {$3000.00}, {$3300.00}, {$990.00}, {$990.00}. The {$3000.00} and {$3300.00} Online ACH Payments were automatically returned by Chase as they suspected fraud ( reflected in blue on the 1-24 screenshot attached ). This left the total fraudulent Online ACH Payments at {$3900.00}. I transferred the balance {$7200.00} left in my account to my credit union to avoid any other transactions being made. I did not see any new emails or phone numbers tied to my account at this time. All of my alerts within my account were turned off, so I was not notified of any transactions or low balance alerts which I previously had set. I contacted Chase and we turned off the online access again. Claims and Fraud departments were closed at this time. On the morning of XX/XX/XXXX, I called Chase and filed a claim with them over the phone. After that, I went back into the branch, and spoke with the same banker. He first suggested that I open a new account, but then he said the new account would be tied to my existing profile so it wouldnt help. He said hes seen this before and that Chase wont help, and that I should open an account at a new bank. I set up a completely new email address, not attached to anything, and we set up completely new usernames and passwords while I was at the bank. When I left the branch, I went to open a new bank account for my business with another bank. Chase temporarily refunded the fraudulent charges totaling {$3900.00} for the following XX/XX/XXXX transactions ( {$500.00}, {$500.00}, {$1000.00}, {$990.00}, {$990.00} ). I ran a Malware check on my computer and there was nothing. I added all notifications back to my account and also added the ACH approval and other recommendations Chase makes to protect your accounts. I also added 2 factor authentication to all my emails and accounts. I consistently get paid by vendors and it takes time to transition those payments so there was still a small amount of money in the account. On XX/XX/XXXX, my account was accessed yet AGAIN! I received a text notification that my balance was below {$500.00}. When I tried to log into my account, I couldnt. I reset the password and logged into my account. This time there was an additional email added onto my account. ( See attached ). There was also 6 Online ACH payments made to one individual totaling {$5100.00}. Individually, the Online ACH Payments were {$990.00}, {$1000.00}, {$980.00}, {$1000.00}, {$900.00}, and {$300.00} ( see attached ). All of the alerts except the one I received letting me know the account was under {$500.00} were turned off my account as well as the ACH approval that I just put in place. I contacted Chase immediately, and they were able to reverse the charges before they fully processed. These charges didnt go through because I caught them fast enough and the fraud department was still open. Chase shut down the online access again, and it has been shut down since XX/XX/XXXX as I dont trust it anymore. I have had to handle all my banking needs in person. On. XX/XX/XXXX, I received a text message that my account balance was $ XXXX. I immediately went into a branch to see what happened, and Chase had reversed the {$3900.00} that was fraudulently taken from my account on XX/XX/XXXX for amounts {$500.00}, {$500.00}, {$1000.00}, {$3000.00}, {$3300.00}, {$990.00}, {$990.00}. The international call center rep with limited English that we were connected with in the bank branch couldnt offer any information except that they were sorry for my inconvenience 50 times and the claim was denied. No detail whatsoever. So I went home and contacted Chase and was left on hold for 1hr 51 minutes ( see attached ) with no representative ever coming back to the phone. I called from another phone and was on hold for 3hr 3 minutes ( see attached ) with no representative ever coming back to the phone.. Simultaneously, I went to the bank branch near me, and after a 30 minute wait, one of the bankers called and was able to get a supervisor in the claims department on the phone. At XXXX, I spoke with the supervisor who could clearly see that this was obvious fraud on my account, and she said she was going to get the claim re-opened. She also said that the claim was denied because there was a new device added to my profile before the claim was filed. I told her the two devices that I use on my profile and if there was another one added that was fraudulent. She also said the claim was denied because there was insufficient documents to support the claim was valid. Chase never notified me if they needed additional documents. The supervisor put me on hold to get the case re-opened, and after 15 minutes of being on hold, the call was dropped. The branch was already closed at this time as it was after XXXX. So defeated again, I went home to try again the next day. The next morning, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX ( see attached ), I called Chase again and spoke with a supervisor who agreed that the case should be re-opened, and she re-opened my claim. This has consumed both my life and business for the last 3 weeks. I have not been able to operate my business, I can not receive my vendor payments, I can not focus. The way I have been treated as if I am the criminal has me in disbelief. Financially, as a small business I can not sustain these losses. I can not pay my vendors and team because of what has happened to my account. I have spent countless hours, lost sleep been highly stressed, and as someone with lupus, this stress can be detrimental. There were so many red flags for Chase to flag these charges. The changing of emails, phone numbers, passwords and removing alerts should have flagged my account. All the sudden ACH payments should have flagged my account. I never make ACH payments from my account. That is simply not typical account behavior for me. Why would I pay the same person 7 times in a row? There were too many red flags, and Chase is absolutely not protecting its clients. Consumers are not safe here. Chase is on the side of the scammers. Where are the checks and balances? I have had my accounts for 7 9 years between them. I have credit cards with Chase, I have good credit, I have a business. Why would I jeopardize my own accounts? Now, I will be forced to go into a legal battle with a huge financial institution. I have more than enough documents to prove my case, especially, since Chase flagged two of the charges as fraud themselves. Chase is absolutely negligent in protecting their customers and in their fraud protocols and approval process.
Explanation:
Category 4: Medical conditions.
The complaint states, "as someone with lupus, this stress can be detrimental," which mentions a specific medical condition.
Label: Yes

Complaint: We purchased a lot and built a home XX/XX/XXXXand moved into our home in XX/XX/XXXXwith a mortgage through Bank of America. 5 years ago, I fell and dislocated my shoulder and my arm became temporarily XXXX and required XXXX as well as XXXX XXXX XXXX. At the time, we did not have health insurance, and this put a great financial burden on us. In addition, we have a business that has had some hardship in the last few years. When we became behind in our house payments, we were not allowed just make one or two payments or partial payments to try to catch up, its all or nothing. We got behind on our house payments and when we tried to talk to Bank of America about a loan modification, they would not talk to us about our options until our payments were caught up. Through great hardship and the determent to other financial obligations, we were able to catch the payments up in XX/XX/XXXX. We tried for several months to get the paperwork started for loan modification with no luck. About XX/XX/XXXX, we were served foreclosure hearing papers. I immediately met with a bankruptcy attorney that I knew to see what I could do to keep the foreclosure from happening. She had several suggestions that I could do before using bankruptcy as a last resort as I wanted to avoid this if I could. She suggested I contact the attorney handling the foreclosure, which was XXXX and XXXX. I sent in all the paperwork for starting a loan modification that they asked for but didnt hear back from them. I was in contact with Bank of America, the lender of both the first mortgage and second mortgage and was told by XXXX XXXX, our account manager, to do a loan modification but to go through her and not the attorneys. She sent us the paperwork and we filled them out and sent in the paperwork they asked for. The paperwork never seemed to be the correct paperwork and they would ask for additional paperwork, many of which were not relevant such as Foreign Exchange P & L, officer compensation, P & L for a company that was no longer in business. All income for both of us were included in our tax returns that we provided, and we told them as much. This was over the course of several months and many conversations with not only XXXX XXXX, but others when she wasnt available. At one point this past fall, XXXX would say our mortgage was sold and when I questioned this, she would look further and avert the conversation and we would continue working on the modification. This happened several times and finally, she told me that our first mortgage had been sold to XXXX XXXX. When I questioned this, she told me she was not obligated to inform me, that it was XXXX XXXX job to send us a letter. Bank of America continued to hold my home equity or 2nd mortgage. I thought that the modification and paperwork would be applied to both accounts and one agent I talked to told me it should, but it wasnt. I immediately started working with XXXX XXXX and my account manager is XXXX XXXX. I began modification paperwork and collecting required paperwork, although I was told by Bank of America that all that would be forwarded. Again, what I would be asked for and turn in never seemed to be correct. One point they seemed to be stuck on was that I was listed as clerical on our tax returns and they felt this was a separate business and wanted a 1099 when in fact it was a job position and the income was listed on our tax return. On the next to the last phone call I got from XXXX, she told me my paperwork would expire on XX/XX/XXXX and I would have to reapply. The last of the paperwork was a XXXX P & L, signed and dated on each page with the dates XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX clearly written, 4506-T form with the correct box checked and proof of homeowners insurance. On XX/XX/XXXX I called XXXX XXXX and at first, someone she was training answered the phone and I tried explaining to him, but XXXX finally got on the phone and I told her I was checking that everything was complete since that was the deadline. She said I still didnt have the correct box checked on the 4506-T and P & L was not correctly stated so I told her Id resend and call her back. I resent the correct forms in 2 emails and called her back to make sure we had everything we needed that same day. She checked her email and said yes and said she would update everything right then since we were on a deadline. On XX/XX/XXXX, I believe this is the correct date, XXXX called me back and told me they could not move forward on the modification because there was a sale date on our house and it was within 38 days. I did not understand what she was talking about and assumed we had a foreclosure date. I asked her if she could tell me why my modification was denied, and she said it wasnt denied and would not continue because a sale date was within 38 days. She told me she could not give me advice but that she would request reinstatement amounts and since it would take time to get it and mail it to me and we didnt have time, she would email me when she got it. I have not received them yet. I called XXXX back to find out who foreclosed so Id know who to talk to, but my call went to voicemail. I called again the next day and again it went to voicemail, so I asked to speak to another agent as time was limited. The man I talked to told me my modification was denied because my paperwork was not turned in on time. When I told him, it was and that I had talked to XXXX to verify, he told me that they did not have to continue with the modification because the sale date was within 38 days and they were not required to inform me. He told me that just because I turned it in on the due date didnt mean it got to the underwriters on time. On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke with XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX because XXXX was not available. I told him I was looking for our loan balance and reinstatement amounts. He looked it up and said that the reinstatement paperwork came in and told me it was {$45000.00}. I explained that XXXX said shed email the paperwork since the sale date was so close. He said that the paperwork was only interoffice, and he couldnt release it but that it had been mailed to me, which I have not yet received. I asked him to please get XXXX to get back with about this and she has not. In late XX/XX/XXXXI got a foreclosure letter from XXXX and XXXX with a date of XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted Bank of America because they were the ones listed on the foreclosure letter and was told that if I could bring my 2nd mortgage to date, it would stop the foreclosure while I worked with XXXX XXXX on the loan modification. During this conversation, I was forwarded to no less than 4 departments and the last department I talked to told me this and wanted payment over the phone but would not take my debit card, would only take account information with routing number and account number. I could not provide this, so she put me on hold and told me since my account was so close to foreclosure, I needed to get a cashier check and take it to a Bank of America branch and ask them to send it interoffice mail and that would stop the foreclosure. I got a cashiers check for the correct amount of {$3900.00} and went to a local bank on XXXX XXXX street. I talked to the customer service rep and he told me he didnt think that this was the most efficient way to process that, so he asked me if I had time for him to inquire about this. So, he called and was also transferred to 4 or 5 different people who he explained the circumstances to and was finally told to post it through the teller. He did this, and its posted, and my account is current until XX/XX/XXXX. After speaking with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, I called Bank of America and spoke with XXXX. I explained my situation and although this was not his department, he put me on hold and check around until he found someone that would help him, it took over an hour. He told me he had turned it over to a colleague and that he would contact XXXX and XXXX and get back with me, I have not heard back from him. It has been the most frustrating and painful experience I've ever had. I believed Bank of America when they said the foreclosure would be cancelled and didn't go to the foreclosure hearing and now have a sale date on my home on XX/XX/XXXX. All I needed to do was set something up to come out of a very bad time and felt I was betrayed. Now I am being forced to file for bankruptcy to try and keep my home for my family and children. When all I needed was time to makeup back payments while continuing with current payments. And BOA as well as XXXX XXXX has made it impossible to do that because it's all or nothing and the modification process is so long and so many roadblocks are put into place that it makes it impossible. There is no reason that this had to get this far. We've been customers for over 20 years and only needed clear support and directions, not the run around until it was too late. I am very disappointed in a company that I have placed my faith in for most of my adult life. We now working on filing bankruptcy but feel that this could all have been avoided if both Bank of American and XXXX XXXX would have just told us what we needed and not give us the run around. It has caused so much unnecessary stress and financial hardship.

this redacted complaint still contains personal information.

Complaint:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name John Smith Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off. 
Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. 
Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is XXXX years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ). 
Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. 
I request an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections.

Product: Credit card
Complaint:
Consumer Complaint : Synchrony Credit Card Deferred Interest Trap In XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a Synchrony credit card to finance my XXXX  XXXX after being offered a promotion of no interest for 24 months. At the time, I was told that : No interest would apply during the promotional period. 

I would receive a heads-up notice before the promotion expired. 

Setting up automatic payments would keep my account in good standing. 

Based on that, I set up autopay ( as recommended ) and made consistent payments for nearly two years, believing I was protected.

However, when I reviewed my account in XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered the following : On XX/XX/XXXX, Synchrony posted {$1100.00} in accrued interest. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the day my promotion expired, they added {$2400.00} in deferred interest charges. 

After XX/XX/XXXX, additional monthly interest charges continued to appear on my statements, even though I was still making payments. 

Here is the record of my balances and statements : XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XXXX XXXX, XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2400.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2400.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2400.00} ( deferred interest applied ) XX/XX/XXXX {$1100.00} ( interest charge posted ) Despite continuous payments, my balance did not go down it increased every month due to back interest and new interest charges. Synchrony claims statements were sent, but no warning was ever provided about the deferred interest expiration, even though I was promised advance notice. 

To make matters worse, the promotion expired specifically on the XXXX of the month, which feels like an intentional setup to catch consumers off guard between billing cycles. Combined with their recommendation to use autopay ( set by default to minimum payments ), this seems designed to ensure most customers fall into the trap. 

My request : I am asking Synchrony to refund the deferred interest charges ( {$1100.00} + {$2400.00} + the ongoing accrued monthly interest shown above ). I entered this financing in good faith and was misled by their advertising and failure to provide a clear notice. 

I am a disabled veteran  and live on a modest income. These surprise charges have been devastating financially, and I believe this practice is intentionally deceptive.

Label: Yes
Category: Veteran information and Physical characteristics or personal descriptors

XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Email : XXXX Phone : XXXX DOB : XX/XX/XXXX SSN ( Last 4 ) : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Account : Credit Collection Services Balance {$210.00} Reported XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal dispute regarding the account being reported by Credit Collection Services on my credit report. This account contains several inaccuracies and missing information that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 
Issues with the Account Reporting : 1. No Original Creditor Identified The report lists Credit Collection Services as both the collection agency and original creditor, which is contradictory and incomplete. 
2. Missing Account Details The account does not provide the account type, account number, or the original service provider the debt allegedly came from. 
3. No Contact or Payment Information There is no address, phone number, or payment channel listed for this collection, preventing me from validating or resolving the debt.
4. Open vs. Collection Status Conflict The account is marked both as Open and Placed for Collection. This is misleading and unfairly impacts my credit.
5. Unverified Balance The {$210.00} balance is not itemized ( no breakdown of principal, interest, or fees ), making it unverifiable. 
Because the account is missing critical information and is reported inaccurately, I am requesting that it be deleted from all of my credit reports unless Credit Collection Services can fully validate it with proper documentation. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, John Smith"

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Complaint:
Complaint Title : Furnishing Unverified Charged-Off Account Failure to Validate Under FCRA This is my third attempt to resolve a serious credit reporting violation involving Goldman Sachs Bank USA . Prior complaints were improperly closed as duplicates, despite addressing legally distinct issues. 

Goldman Sachs continues to furnish a charged-off account to the credit bureaus without providing legally required documentation to verify the accuracy, ownership, or validity of the alleged debt. 

Their only response has been to mail a packet containing generic transaction history which does not constitute legal validation under the FCRA or XXXX XXXX reporting guidelines.

To date, Goldman Sachs has failed to provide : A signed credit agreement or original application A complete charge-off ledger A XXXX or tax-related discharge documentation Proof of assignment, legal ownership, or chain of title No legally sufficient evidence has been produced to justify the continued furnishing of this tradeline. Transaction history is not proof of a valid, collectible, or legally reportable debt. 

This complaint is not about the validity of individual charges it is about the unlawful furnishing of incomplete and unverified data by Goldman Sachs in violation of FCRA 623. 

I am formally objecting to the continued reporting of this item and requesting a full reinvestigation. If no proper verification is provided, I will escalate this matter to the OCC, state regulators, and legal counsel for further action.

Product: Credit card
Complaint:
On XX/XX/year>, I sent Absolute Resolutions Investments , LLC a certified demand letter invoking my legal rights as a debtor under UCC 9-210, requesting a certified accounting of an alleged debt of {$10000.00}. This included a formal request for certified ledger transactions, general ledger entries, loss deficit reports, red and black entries, and certified financial statements that could demonstrate that a legitimate financial loss or damage had been sustained by the alleged creditor.

Under UCC 9-210, as the secured party, Absolute Resolutions has a fiduciary obligation to respond to my formal request. As the debtor, I exercised my legal right to request an accounting of the obligation they claim exists. To date, they have failed to comply within the required 14-day statutory period, and no such certified audit or financial proof has been provided. 

This failure to respond constitutes a failure to meet the legal burden of proof for enforcing any claim of debt. Without certified accounting, the only legally recognizable balance is a credit balance in the amount of {$10000.00}, which under 15 U.S. Code 1666d must be returned as a refund. Any further collection activity on an unverified or fictitious debt becomes legally questionable.

Moreover, if no financial loss has occurredand if no verified chain of title, general ledger, or certified audit from a licensed accountant can be providedthe continued attempt to collect this alleged debt may constitute : Mail Fraud ( 18 U.S.C. 1341 ) : Using the U.S. Postal Service to pursue a fictitious debt.

Wire Fraud ( 18 U.S.C. 1343 ) : Communicating by electronic means ( calls, emails, etc. ) to enforce a non-existent obligation.

False Credit Reporting ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : Reporting a credit balance as a delinquent debt on consumer credit reports.

Violation of Disclosure Obligations ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. ) : Misrepresenting the nature of the account balance and failing to disclose material facts.

Unfair and Deceptive Practices ( 15 U.S.C. 45 ) under the Federal Trade Commission Act : Misrepresenting a credit balance as a delinquent debt and refusing refund obligations. 

Violation of XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : Refusal or inability to produce auditable financial statements violates basic financial reporting standards. 

I believe this behavior demonstrates a systemic pattern of unfair, deceptive, and potentially fraudulent business conduct, and I am requesting a full investigation.

Summary of Included Legal Grounds : UCC 9-210 : Secured party must comply with certified accounting requests from a debtor.

15 USC 1666d : Credit balances must be refunded.

15 USC 1681 : Fair Credit Reporting Act violations for false reporting.

15 USC 1601 : Truth in Lending Act disclosure violations.

15 USC 45 : FTC Act prohibiting unfair/deceptive practices.

18 USC 1341 & 1343 : Mail and wire fraud for using deceptive means to collect. 

XXXX : Lack of proper accounting violates accepted standards.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Complaint:
Name : XXXX XXXX Address Line : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Document Date : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Subject : REQUEST LETTER TO REMOVE INACCURATE INFORMATION To Whom It May Concern, Please accept this formal letter as my first request to investigate and remove derogatory accounts/items from my consumer report. Going over my report, I have found it has errors. It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I believe to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. 
As a consumer reporting agency 15 U.S.C. $ 1681a ( f ), you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 'FCRA '' ). 15 U.S.C. 1681, et seq., which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their consumer file. The FCRA states that it's the consumer reporting agency 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer files is accurate and free from errors. 
Your company is regularly engaged in the business of assembling, evaluating, and disbursing information concerning consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports, as defined in 15 U.S.C. {$1600.00} ( d ), to third parties.

According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to : 1 ) follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This section imposes a high and often disregarded standard on consumer reporting agencies. See, e.g., XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ( breaking down the requirements of 1681e ( b ), and explaining that " assure ' means 'to make sure or certain : put beyond all doubt, '' ' [ maximum ' means the 'greatest in quantity or highest degree attainable [, ] ' and 'possible ' means something falling within the bounds of what may be done, occur or be conceived. '' ( quoting XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) ) ; 2 ) comply with the investigation requirements, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ; 3 ) should not provide consumer files to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer files pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; 4 ) provide consumer file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681g ; 5 ) et seq. 
Accordingly, I request your company to provide verifiable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it ) you have on file of accounts/items listed below. Under the FCRA, if you do not provide documented and verifiable proof, you must remove all unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report. 
For your convenience, I am sending you a list of the items you need to verify them. These listed accounts are neither my debts nor my authorized inquiries. Please correct this by the removal of these items from my consumer report. See. Exhibit A. 
Upon completion of your investigation, please send a detailed description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy of the accounts/items XXXX XXXX disputing, as well as the name and contact information of the agent conducting the said investigation in case further communication is necessary.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Complaint:
I am filing this complaint against Toyota Motor Credit Corporation ( TMCC ) regarding an account that is inaccurately and unlawfully being reported to XXXX  and other reporting agencies. The account appears twice on my credit report under the same masked account number, but with conflicting statuses one reporting as closed and never late, and the other as a derogatory charge-off with a balance. This is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates maximum possible accuracy. 

Further, based on XXXX  own publicly filed financial documents including their XXXX, XXXX, Form XXXX, and trust filings with the SEC the account in question appears to have been sold and transferred into a legally isolated, bankruptcy-remote trust. TMCC clearly states in its filings that once receivables are transferred to securitized trusts, they are no longer TMCCs assets and are removed from their balance sheet. This means TMCC is no longer the owner or creditor of the account, and their continued furnishing of data to the credit bureaus constitutes misrepresentation under FCRA and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). They are falsely representing ownership of a debt they no longer hold, while also acting as a debt collector without proper disclosure a violation of FDCPA 807 and 809. 

Additionally, this reporting appears to violate XXXX XXXX compliance standards, particularly in the use of incorrect ownership codes, failure to flag the account as transferred or sold, and duplication of account status. TMCC may also be in violation of IRS Code 6050P if the account has been charged off and no 1099-C has been issued, as is required for discharged indebtedness. 

The companys actions also raise serious concerns under XXXX standards including the misclassification of assets, unjust revenue recognition, and reversal of receivables all of which are documented and contradicted within their own SEC filings. 

Given these findings, I am requesting that the CFPB initiate a full investigation into Toyota Motor Credits credit reporting practices, require deletion of the inaccurate and derogatory tradeline ( s ), and compel TMCC to cease all reporting and collection activity on the account if they can not provide full legal validation of ownership and servicing rights. 

I am submitting all supporting documentation, including SEC filings, credit report excerpts, and a detailed legal summary.
Label: No

Product: Credit card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Complaint:
XX/XX/year> Application and Proof Submission I applied after seeing a XXXX SkyMiles offer. 

I took a screenshot of the offer and saved it before applying. 

When I inquired about confirmation, Amex claimed I was only enrolled in a XXXXmile offer and opened Case # XXXX. 

XXXX ( XX/XX/year> ) : First Follow-Ups I contacted Amex multiple times to clarify that this was not a better offer request but the advertised XXXX offer I applied under. 

I was told the matter was under investigation with a 68 week timeline. 

I specifically told Amex that I needed these points for my honeymoon travel in late XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/year> ) : Continued Delays and Deflections I followed up again and was told no option to expedite. 

A representative stated that the investigation could take up to 90 days. 

This directly contradicts the urgent timing I had emphasized since my first call. 

At this stage, I had already submitted all necessary documentation, but Amex stalled. 

XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/year> ) : Supervisor Escalation I escalated to a floor supervisor who falsely described this as a better offer investigation. 

I corrected the record this was not an upgrade request but the exact offer I was promised. 

Even with my screenshot proof, Amex refused to provide confirmation that the XXXX miles would be honored. 

I reiterated that my honeymoon was weeks away, and Amexs delays were now making it impossible to use the miles in time. 

XXXX ( XX/XX/year> ) : Continued Stonewalling I was told again to check back in 24 weeks, pushing resolution further past my travel timeline. 

Despite my clear explanation of time-sensitive harm, Amex repeatedly cited internal processes and maximum 68 weeks language. 

Amex also advertised a XXXX SkyMiles offer on the same card during this period proving higher offers were available, yet my documented XXXX offer remains unhonored. 


Why This Is a Regulatory Concern : Truth in Lending Act ( Regulation Z ) : Promotional terms must be accurately disclosed at the time of application. 
The XXXX SkyMiles offer was a material term I relied upon in making my application. 

FTC Act ( Section 5 Deceptive Practices ) : This is a textbook bait-and-switch. 
Amex advertised XXXX miles, induced me to apply, then tried to downgrade me to XXXX miles and stall resolution until the offer became irrelevant for my needs. 

Unfair Business Practices : Delaying resolution for 612 weeks ensures that customers with time-sensitive travel needs can not use the miles they were promised. 

This creates financial harm and undermines consumer trust. I will move most of my business to XXXX. They have better welcome offers and actually honor them. They have the back of the consumer. Visa cards might be the best way to go. 


Harm Caused : Loss of Time : Over six weeks wasted in repetitive chats, with no progress beyond we are investigating. 

Loss of Value : I can not receive the points before my XXXX honeymoon, undermining the reason I applied.

Loss of Trust : Multiple agents minimized the issue by calling it a better offer when it was the exact advertised offer. Cold and unhelpful responses from representatives. 

Financial Harm : I may be forced to pay significantly more for flights/hotels out-of-pocket because Amex withheld the points.
Explanation:
Category 2: Physical characteristics or personal descriptors.
The complaint mentions the complainant's "honeymoon," which indicates their marital status, a personal descriptor.
Label: No

15 U.S. Code $ 1681c-2 a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any.

information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt.

15 U.S. Code 1681 Section B ( i ) - Requirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material - If a consumer reporting agency removes information from someone's credit file based on the requirements in the preceding section ( A ), the agency can not re-add or reinsert that previously deleted information back into the person 's file unless the entity that originally provided that information certifies that it is complete and accurate.

XX/XX/year> : I raised this issue with XXXX XXXX  internally.

That same day, I was placed on paid administrative leave. 
XX/XX/year> : I was officially terminated from my position. 

Based on my experience, I am concerned that this may not be an isolated case. Product: Credit card
Complaint:
Consumer Complaint : Synchrony Credit Card Deferred Interest Trap In XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a Synchrony credit card to finance my XXXX  XXXX after being offered a promotion of no interest for 24 months. At the time, I was told that : No interest would apply during the promotional period. 

I would receive a heads-up notice before the promotion expired. 

Setting up automatic payments would keep my account in good standing. 

Based on that, I set up autopay ( as recommended ) and made consistent payments for nearly two years, believing I was protected.

However, when I reviewed my account in XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered the following : On XX/XX/XXXX, Synchrony posted {$1100.00} in accrued interest. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the day my promotion expired, they added {$2400.00} in deferred interest charges. 

After XX/XX/XXXX, additional monthly interest charges continued to appear on my statements, even though I was still making payments. 

Here is the record of my balances and statements : XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} XXXX XXXX, XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2300.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2400.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2400.00} XX/XX/XXXX {$2400.00} ( deferred interest applied ) XX/XX/XXXX {$1100.00} ( interest charge posted ) Despite continuous payments, my balance did not go down it increased every month due to back interest and new interest charges. Synchrony claims statements were sent, but no warning was ever provided about the deferred interest expiration, even though I was promised advance notice. 

To make matters worse, the promotion expired specifically on the XXXX of the month, which feels like an intentional setup to catch consumers off guard between billing cycles. Combined with their recommendation to use autopay ( set by default to minimum payments ), this seems designed to ensure most customers fall into the trap. 

My request : I am asking Synchrony to refund the deferred interest charges ( {$1100.00} + {$2400.00} + the ongoing accrued monthly interest shown above ). I entered this financing in good faith and was misled by their advertising and failure to provide a clear notice. 

I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX  and live on a modest income. These surprise charges have been devastating financially, and I believe this practice is intentionally deceptive.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Complaint:
This letter serves as my formal notice of dispute concerning certain account listed on my credit report that I believe was accessed or reported without a permissible purpose as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S. Code 1681b. Under the FCRA, a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only under specific, lawful purposes listed in 1681b ( a ). Any entity that accessed my credit file without my authorization or without a valid legal reason has done so in violation of this federal law. 

Upon reviewing my credit reports, I found entries that I did not authorize, nor did I initiate any transaction that would justify such access. These unauthorized entries violate 1681b ( f ), which prohibits users from obtaining a consumer report without a permissible purpose. 

Legal Precedent : In the case of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX. ), the court ruled in favor of the plaintiff, stating that a credit report pulled without a valid permissible purpose under FCRA constitutes a willful violation, which is actionable. 

Furthermore, multiple credit bureaus were defendants in recent lawsuits filed in XXXX for re-reporting or permitting access to consumer reports after the accounts were removed, which is also considered a willful disregard of consumer rights. 


XXXX XXXX XXXX

I am writing to formally dispute and request the immediate reinvestigation of inaccurate and incomplete information appearing in my credit file in Experian, Equifax, TransUnion. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of all disputed items and remove or correct any information that can not be verified as accurate and complete within 30 days. 

1. Personal Information Inaccuracies Your records currently contain incorrect variations of my name and outdated addresses. Please update my file to reflect my correct legal name and current address.

Please delete all other name variations and remove all outdated addresses not listed above. These variations are causing confusion and may be linked to accounts that do not belong to me.

2. Disputed Accounts I dispute the accuracy, validity, and completeness of the following accounts currently appearing in my credit report : XXXX. XXXX XXXX Charge-off Unverified reporting and inconsistent balance history. 
2. XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ) Collection Lack of original creditor contract and payment history. 
3. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Collection Duplicate reporting of the same alleged debt as XXXX  XXXX XXXX 
4. Dept of Education/XXXX Multiple duplicate tradelines with {$0.00} balances and late payment history ; should be consolidated into a single accurate account. 
5. XXXX XXXX Charge-off Missing contractual evidence and payment documentation. 
6. XXXX XXXX Charge-off Unverified and lacking original creditor agreement. 
XXXX. XXXX  XXXX Charge-off Amount in dispute ; no contractual evidence provided. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Charge-off Inconsistent reporting and unverifiable payment history. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Missing proof of ownership and assignment of debt. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Duplicate and inconsistent reporting. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Charge-off Incomplete and unverifiable payment records. 

3. Legal Basis for Dispute Under the FCRA : * 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) You must reinvestigate disputed information and delete or correct it if it can not be verified.
* 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) Information furnishers must not report inaccurate information.

* 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) Obsolete information must not be reported beyond the allowable time period. 
Unless you can provide verifiable documentation from the original creditor : including signed contracts, complete payment histories, and proof of account ownership. You must delete these accounts from my credit file. A simple statement that the account was verified is insufficient under the law. 

4. Requested Action Please complete your reinvestigation and send me written confirmation of the results within 30 days, as required by law. If you verify any of the accounts, provide me with the complete documentation from the original creditor that was used to verify the account.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect compliance with all applicable federal laws and look forward to receiving your response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Complaint:
I am writing to dispute an account that is being reported on my credit report, which constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2. Therefore, I respectfully request that this information be blocked or deleted immediately.

I am enclosing a copy of my Identity Theft Report issued by the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX, as supporting evidence for my claim. 

According to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, once a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies are legally required to block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from such identity theft within four ( 4 ) business days.

The following information in my credit file is the result of a clear FCRA violation and must be blocked immediately : XXXX / Account Number : XXXXXXXX XXXX  / Account Number : XXXX Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which states that a credit reporting agency may not include information in a consumers file unless there is a valid authorization or permissible purpose. I never authorized the opening or reporting of this account, and there is no signed contract or consent from me that justifies its inclusion in my credit report. 

Therefore, the continued presence of this account constitutes not only a result of identity theft but also the unauthorized use and disclosure of my personal information, in direct violation of the FCRAs requirements.

In accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 and 1681b, I respectfully request that this account be blocked and deleted immediately from my credit report and that it no longer be reported in any manner. 

I have contacted TransUnion on multiple occasions to report this account, but I have yet to receive a clear or definitive resolution to this matter. This situation is causing me serious harm, as I am in the process of purchasing a new home for my children and seeking financial tools to support my economic growth. These negative accounts are blocking my opportunities and causing both personal and financial damage. 

Furthermore, this account has already been deleted by other credit bureaus, as they were unable to verify it under the procedures required by law. I do not understand why this agency continues to report this account on my credit file. 

I have also requested copies of any contracts related to this account from the company reporting it, and after more than 60 days, I have not received a single response. This further supports the fact that there is no verifiable evidence or legal basis for continuing to report this information. 

I respectfully request that you assist me by removing this account immediately.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Complaint:
I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding an alleged debt you claim I owe. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I formally dispute this debt and request full validation of your claim. Under federal law, you are required to cease all collection activities until you provide adequate verification of the alleged debt.

Request for Verification : Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), you must provide : 1. Proof of your legal standing to collect this debt, including a valid assignment or chain of title demonstrating ownership of the debt from the original creditor to your agency.

2. A full itemization of the alleged debt, including principal, interest, fees, and all charges.

3. Copies of any contracts or agreements bearing my signature that establish my liability for this alleged debt.

4. Proof that the original creditor did not receive any insurance payment, government relief, or tax write-off that nullifies the debt under case precedents such as Perry v. Stewart Title Co. , 756 F.2d 1197 ( 5th Cir. 1985 ).

Potential Fraud Concerns : I also challenge the legitimacy of this debt on the grounds that the original creditor may have already received compensation for any alleged loss. If the creditor was insured against default or received compensation through other means ( such as an insurance policy, a tax write-off or government bailout ), then the alleged obligation may have been extinguished. Courts have held that a party can not seek double recovery for the same loss, as seen in FDIC v. United Pac. Ins. Co., 20 F.3d 1070 ( 10th Cir. 1994 ).

Additionally, if the debt has been securitized and sold as part of an asset-backed security, the original creditor may no longer have a valid claim, as illustrated in Carpenter v. Longan , 83 U.S. 271 ( 1872 ), which supports the principle that the note and security instrument can not be separated.

Creditor Accepted payment. Account already discharged : The alleged debt was already paid and discharged by the alleged creditor. Please cease all collection activity. 

CREDENCE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT , LLC Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Reference # : XXXX
Explanation: This redacted complaint does not still contain any of the four types of personal information.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Complaint:
I received a letter dated XX/XX/year>, from Nelson & Kennard XXXX attempting to collect an alleged XXXX  XXXX XXXX charged-off account. The letter is on attorney letterhead listing numerous lawyers, but in the fine print they disclose : Nelson & Kennard, LLP is a debt collector. This communication raises several serious violations : 1. False or misleading representation ( 1692e FDCPA ) : The letter strongly implies attorney involvement and review, but no licensed attorney appears to have reviewed my account individually. Using attorney letterhead without actual legal involvement is deceptive and intimidating.

Listing numerous state bar licenses while functioning purely as a collection agency is a misrepresentation intended to pressure the consumer.

2. Failure to provide validation of debt ( 1692g FDCPA ) : The letter does not provide any proof of ownership, assignment, or contract. It references a XXXX  XXXX XXXX account that was already charged-off. 
No supporting documents were included with their initial communication, which is a violation.

3. Collecting without proof of standing : If Nelson & Kennard owns the account, they must disclose assignment/chain of title. If they do not, they are attempting to collect without proof they are the rightful creditor.

This is a direct violation of both the FDCPA and Californias Rosenthal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

4. Threat of credit reporting without validation : Their letter pressures me to pay or respond, but does not acknowledge that they can not legally report this to consumer reporting agencies without validation.

5. California Rosenthal Act violations : This firm is operating in California and is therefore subject to additional protections for consumers. Their letter engages in misleading intimidation tactics that are prohibited.
Label: No

Complaint:
I have been trying remove this charge off of my credit report. This is not accurate and needs to be deleted off my account. The creditors are not doing their job and this is hurting my score and Im trying to start a business and get a home. So please help me out. 

( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 
( B ) Requirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material ( i ) Certification of accuracy of information If any information is deleted from a consumers file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ), the information may not be reinserted in the file by the consumer reporting agency unless the person who furnishes the information certifies that the information is complete and accurate. 

( ii ) Notice to consumer If any information that has been deleted from a consumers file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) is reinserted in the file, the consumer reporting agency shall notify the consumer of the reinsertion in writing not later than 5 business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency. 

( iii ) Additional information As part of, or in addition to, the notice under clause ( ii ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing not later than 5 business days after the date of the reinsertion ( I ) a statement that the disputed information has been reinserted ; ( II ) the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available, or of any furnisher of information that contacted the consumer reporting agency, in connection with the reinsertion of such information ; and ( III ) a notice that the consumer has the right to add a statement to the consumers file disputing the accuracy or completeness of the disputed information.
